basics.name: Francisco Gutierrez
basics.label: Quantitative Developer, Haskell Functional Programmer, AI Research Engineer.
basics.summary:
Software Engineer with 15+ years of experience. Proficient in Haskell and Python, currently excited about Julia, but comfortable with most popular languages. Best at Quantitative Development in the intersection between math and software. Looking to work on mathematical applications such as AI, NLP, Machine Learning, Data Science, Quantitative Finance, Bioinformatics, Statistics, etc.  

I am based in Miami Beach and not looking to relocate, so I am open to remote work, and local work in Miami Beach only. 
Github: https://github.com/freefrancisco

Please do not call me. All unsolicited calls will go directly to spam, and your number will get blocked. Asynchronous communications like email, linkedin messages, or even text messages are fine, but if we need to talk in real time let's schedule a zoom, jitsi, or google meet.

work.name: Tontine Trust
work.summary: Writing quantitative finance simulations in Haskell

work.name: Independent Study Program
work.summary:
Independent study learning the rapidly evolving new technological options made possible by LLMs. Some highlights include: 
* Currently Going through the Coursera certification on Natural Language Processing.
  Completed: 
  - Natural Language Processing With Classification And Vector Spaces
  - Natural Language Processing With Probabilistic Models
 To finish: 
  - Natural Language Processing With Sequence Models
  - Natural Language Processing With Attention Models
* DeepLearning.AI short courses:
  - ChatGPT Prompt Engineering For Developers
  - LangChain for LLM Application Development
* Extensive experimentation with GPT-4 as an aide to learning, programming, writing, and other knowledge intensive tasks. 
* Building chat bots based on fictional characters using the OpenAI API

work.name: NFTYEA
work.summary:
Main developer and technical co-founder for web3 artificial intelligence startup to aggregate, categorize, and summarize information from public sources for NFT/crypto investors using GPT-3. Developed application in Haskell using IHP. AI research, optimization, and fine tuning done in Julia. Managed team of front end Javascript developers. Took the application all the way from idea to production. 
Url: https://www.nftyea.io/

work.name: Independent Study Program
work.summary:
Took some time off to learn more about crypto technologies after moving from San Francisco to Miami Beach. Some of my independent study included
* Crypto, web3, and bitcoin conferences around Miami area. 
* Chaincode seminar on Bitcoin Protocol Development (https://github.com/chaincodelabs/bitcoin-curriculum)
* Chaincode seminar on Lightning Network (https://github.com/chaincodelabs/lightning-curriculum)
* Stacks protocol clarity language camp (https://clarity-lang.org/miami)
* Familiar with Cardano Plutus language for smart contracts using Haskell
* Self study on Julia for machine learning, data science, and statistics as a better alternative to Python and R.

work.name: Capital One
work.summary:
- Functional programming in Haskell. Wrote simulations/agent based models to generate synthetic data that matches real distributions. Evangelized Haskell internally, mentored other developers in the use of Haskell and functional programming techniques.
- Machine learning. Developed models for synthetic data product, mentored coworkers on machine learning, led internal machine learning reading group, led team in reinforcement learning competition.
- Internal entrepreneurship. Wore many hats as part of the team that took the synthetic data product from idea to production.
- Five patent applications around agent based models and synthetic data, main author in two of them. Look at the patent section for details.

work.name: Independent Study Program
work.summary:
- Independent study of deep learning, reinforcement learning, deep reinforcement learning, Julia, and Haskell. 
- Deep Learning with Andrew Ng's Coursera specialization, https://www.deeplearning.ai/. 
- Deep Learning with book by Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, and Aaron Courville, http://www.deeplearningbook.org/.
- Reinforcement Learning with book by Richard Sutton and Andrew Barto, Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction, http://incompleteideas.net/book/the-book-2nd.html.
- Deep Reinforcement Learning with class by Sergey Levine, http://rll.berkeley.edu/deeprlcourse/. 
- Haskell with book by Christopher Allen and Julie Moronuki, Haskell Programming From First Principles, http://haskellbook.com/.
- Developing with Python, Tensorflow, Keras, Numpy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter, Julia, and Haskell.

work.name: CollabRx
work.summary:
- Designed and developed knowledge database for precision medicine cancer treatment recommendations.
- Developed with Python, graph database Neo4j, functional language Elixir, and Phoenix web framework.

work.name: Gumroad

- Main developer and maintainer of machine learning application for risk scoring and fraud detection.
- Developed in Python with Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy, Jupyter notebooks, and Flask.

work.name: Liquid Labs (now Gigster)
work.summary:
-   Main developer for all ideas in fast idea to prototype cycle. Projects included contact management tool, webRTC video chat application, experts exchange, and online stock market game.
-   Developed with Mongo, Node, Javascript, Coffeescript, Meteor, and Python.

work.name: Tapjoy
work.summary:

- Developed with Python, Octave, R, Hadoop, Pig, Hive, Vertica, Ruby, and Rails.

work.name: Kabam
work.summary:

- Developed with Ruby, Rails, MySQL, and Redis.

work.name: bieMEDIA
work.summary: - Developed web and command line applications for order management, data scraping and aggregation, process management, automated link clicking, search, and automated video generation.

work.name: Mercurio Marketing LLC
work.summary:
- Ran my own promotions and even production company for a while in order to develop some of the softer skills of business and round out my engineering background.  
- Production of rock in Spanish concerts, and weekly nightclub events.  Rock in Spanish band management.  Modeling agency focusing on Spanish speaking bilingual models for promotions, and gogo dancers for night clubs.
- Software development and consulting services.

work.summary:

- Developed with R, Ruby, Java, and MySQL.

work.name: Collective Intellect

work.name: Dante Group / WebMethods
work.summary:
- Developed statistical anomaly detection, failure prediction, and real time OLAP software for analysis engine of business activity monitoring and business intelligence product.

work.name: Quark Software Inc.
work.summary:
- Developed ad and content personalization technology for publishers leading a team of three people. 
- Authored a patent application on the personalization technology, see patents section for more information.

work.name: MicroStrategy
work.summary:
- Associate program for recent college graduates included a 6 week bootcamp where where we studied SQL, Data Warehousing and Decision Support Systems in depth. Then we had a rotation through different areas of the company. 
- I worked in marketing, product management, and web development.

work.name: First Quadrant
work.summary:
- Analyzed historical market data to create computational financial models.
- Wrote C++ genetic algorithms for a summer internship.

work.name: Japan Development Bank
work.summary:
- Wrote and presented report on Internet commerce, business opportunities created by the Internet, uses of the Internet in traditional businesses, and impact of the Internet in the global economy. 
- Experienced Japanese culture, customs, language, and business practices.

references.name: Leela Krishna Kadiri
references.reference: Francisico is a coder extraordinaire. His skills in Ruby are amazing. At one point I remember him writing Ruby code that generates and runs Php code. He has a knack for learning new languages and coding techniques and is always on the cutting edge of technology. He is a great guy to work with and learn from and also an awesome Salsa dancer from what i heard.

references.name: Phil Swenson
references.reference: Francisco is an extremely smart guy.  Great technologist, great a managing complexity and making it simple.  Hope to work with him again the future!

references.name: SÃ¸ren Maigaard-Tobiasen
references.reference:
Francisco is an amazing individual. He lead our efforts in creating AI algorithms to detect unusual activity in streams of data and helped implement this into our cloud based software architecture.
He is never afraid of tackling new challenges. Although his expertise was in maths, he attacked software engineering with a passion. 
His personality makes it impossible not to like him and his enthusiasm can get anyone carried away.

references.name: Adriana Muro
references.reference: Francisco is a fast learner, sharp and commited.  Very independent and methodic.
